intro: Myrsine panamensis, commonly known as Panama myrsine, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests. Myrsine panamensis produces small, dark berries that are an important food source for various wildlife species.
